Package nzilbb.encoding

Class Unisyn2DISC

  • java.lang.Object
    • nzilbb.encoding.PhonemeTranslator
      • nzilbb.encoding.Unisyn2DISC
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Function<String,​String>, UnaryOperator<String>
    public class Unisyn2DISC
extends PhonemeTranslator
    Translates Unisyn-encoded phonemic transcriptions like ~ t r a n . * s k r i p . sh @ n to CELEX-DISC-encoded transcriptions like "tr{n-'skrIp-S@n.

    This converts not only the phonemes, but also syllabification and stress markers:

    • * → ' - primary stress
    • ~ → " - secondary stress
    • - → , - tertiary stress
    • . → - - syllable boundary
    Mapping
    UnisynDISCExample
    Stress/syllabification
    * â†’ ' primary stress
    ~ â†’ " secondary stress
    - â†’ , tertiary stress
    . â†’ - syllable boundary
    Vowels
    e â†’ E DRESS
    a â†’ { TRAP
    ou â†’ 5 GOAT (but a monophthong for edi)
    o â†’ Q LOT
    ah â†’ # START
    oo â†’ $ THOUGHT (but a diphthong in some en-US)
    ii â†’ i FLEECE
    i â†’ I KIT
    @ â†’ @ schwa
    uh â†’ V STRUT
    u â†’ U FOOT
    uu â†’ u GOOSE

    ai â†’ 2 PRICE
    oi â†’ 4 CHOICE
    ow â†’ 6 MOUTH
    i@ â†’ 7 NEAR
    @@r â†’ 3 NURSE
    eir â†’ 8 SQUARING (actually a monophthong in many)
    ur â†’ 9 JURY
    (troublesome because they map in accent-specific ways)
    ar â†’ Q start â†’ PALM â†’ LOT (US) (but START (RP))
    aa â†’ Q PALM â†’ LOT (US) (but START (RP))
    oa â†’ { BANANA â†’ TRAP (US) (but START (RP))
    ao â†’ # MAZDA â†’ START (but TRAP (NZ))
    2-to-1

    @r â†’ @ r-coloured schwa
